items.title: A Photo Travel Diary of Architectural Grids and Patterns
items.abstract: The New York-based photographer Won Kim seeks out the beauty in the mundane.

items.title: Decorating With Hundreds of Butterflies
items.abstract: In London, an interior decorator framed 257 prints from an old French book — to make an incredible design statement.

items.title: City Never Sleeps, Yet Number of Trains at Off-Peak Hours Decline
items.abstract: A growing army of riders take the subways outside of typical commuting hours, but the M.T.A. has not kept pace with off-hours trains.

items.title: Home Design Objects That Move Away From Minimalism
items.abstract: Objects in playful patterns and vibrant colors are a lighthearted break from the tyranny of too much refinement.

items.title: Three Rising Talents Spotted at the London Design Festival
items.abstract: T rounds up a few young standouts (all of whom happen to be women) involved with this week’s fair.
